column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Nishinomiya
#Text=Nishinomiya ( 西宮 ) is a city in Hyogo prefecture , Japan .
#Text=It is located inbetween Kobe and Osaka
#Text=Understand
#Text=The city is the setting for much of the Studio Ghibli film Grave of the Fireflies .
#Text=There was heavy damage throughout the city from the Great Hanshin Earthquake on January 17 , 1995 .
#Text=This city is also the setting for the anime The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya .
#Text=While taking pictures of Nishinomiya-Kita High School ( where much of the anime is set ) from the outside is perfectly legal , entering the gates to take pictures inside is not .
#Text=Hankyu Imazu line is the setting for Hankyu Railway movie , where stations from Nishinomiya-Kitaguchi Station to Takarazuka Station appear in the movie .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Nishinomiya has access to three airports : Kansai International Airport , Kobe Airport , and Osaka International Airport .
#Text=Despite its name , Osaka International Airport is a domestic airport .
#Text=There is bus service to and from the airport for ¥ 700 to Hanshin Koshien Station and Hankyu Nishinomiya-kitaguchi Station .
#Text=Kansai International Airport also has bus service for ¥ 1700 ( or ¥ 3000 round trip ) to and from JR Nishinomiya , Hankyu Nishinomiya-kitaguchi , and Hanshin Nishinomiya stations .
#Text=By train
#Text=The Shinkansen ( 新幹線 ) is another option when traveling from other parts of Japan .
#Text=Nishinomiya can be reached from either Shin-Kobe or Shin-Osaka stations .
#Text=A one-way reserved ticket on the Nozomi from Tokyo to Osaka costs ¥ 14,050 .
#Text=A one-way reserved ticket on the Hikari Railstar from Hiroshima to Kobe costs ¥ 9740 .
#Text=Visitors can then take the subway or train to get to the city .
#Text=To get from Shin-Kobe to Nishinomiya , take the ¥ 200 subway to Sannomiya and then either JR , Hanshin , or Hankyu train lines into Nishinomiya .
#Text=Depending on the train stop , the ticket will only cost a couple of hundred yen .
#Text=Get around
#Text=There are three main train lines running through Nishinomiya : JR , Hanshin ( 阪神 ) , and Hankyu ( 阪急 ) .
#Text=They run parallel to each other and go from east to west , with the Hanshin and Hankyu lines connected by the small Imazu line between Hanshin Imazu station and Nishinomiya-kitaguchi ( 西宮北口 ) .
#Text=Hanshin and Hankyu buses also run throughout the city , though it can be difficult to travel from north to south .
#Text=See
#Text=Hanshin Tigers ( 阪神タイガース ) .
#Text=Go to Koshien Stadium to see one of Japan 's oldest baseball teams .
#Text=Fans of the Tigers are known to be the most fanatical and dedicated .
#Text=The stadium itself is the oldest in Japan and is famous for having a grass field , dirt infield , and being visited by Babe Ruth .
#Text=The summer high school baseball tournament is held here every year .
#Text=Hyogo Performing Arts Center ( The center is closest to Hankyu Nishinomiya-Kitaguchi Station .
#Text=It 's about a 2-minute walk and is connected to the station by a walkway ) .
#Text=The venue offers a variety of performances such as orchestra concerts , ballets , plays , and operas .
#Text=Some performances include a Japanese puppet show ( tickets start at ¥ 2000 ) or a traditional Nutcracker ballet ( tickets from ¥ 4000 - 12,000 ) .
#Text=Manchidani Park ( 満池谷公園 ) ( to get to the reservoir take the train to Hankyu Kurakuen-guchi station and walk about 10 minutes to the east ) .
#Text=Not so much a park , but part of a series of reservoirs called Nitekoike .
#Text=This place is particularly beautiful during cherry blossom season and is a famous scene from the novel Grave of the Fireflies by Akiyuki Nosaka .
#Text=Nishinomiya Shrine ( 西宮神社 ) .
#Text=It is a Shinto shrine near Hanshin Nishinomiya Station .
#Text=The Ebisu festival is held here every year in January .
#Text=Do
#Text=Hanami .
#Text=Go to Shukugawa Park ( 夙川公園 ) end of March/early April for Nishinomiya 's most popular hanami location .
#Text=There are over 2300 cherry blossom trees along the Shukugawa River that stretches all the way from Hanshin Koroen Station to Hankyu Kurakuen-guchi station .
#Text=Get off at either of these train stations or Hankyu Shukugawa Station to enjoy the festival .
#Text=Kidzania .
#Text=In this roleplaying theme park children can act out different occupations , earn money , and learn about the adult world .
#Text=Located next to Lalaport .
#Text=Mukogawa Cycling Road .
#Text=This is a 7.1-km-long cycling road along the Mukogawa River from the JR line to Hanshin line .
#Text=It 's a nice place to enjoy cycling free of cars .
#Text=Bikes can be rented for the day at hotels in the area .
#Text=National High School Baseball Championship ( 全国高等学校野球選手権大会 ) .

column3: 全国高等学校野球選手権大会

column1: #Text=Every summer in August , Japan 's national high school baseball tournament is held at Koshien Stadium .
#Text=Games are free so it 's an excellent opportunity to participate in this popular national event !
#Text=Buy
#Text=ACTA Nishinomiya .
#Text=Near Nishinomiya Gardens , this shopping area is made up of two buildings and is just north of the train station .
#Text=The shopping center has a branch Junkudo ( ジュンク堂 ) where you can find a good selection of English language books and Japanese learning materials .
#Text=Lalaport Koshien .
#Text=A small mall with stores , restaurants , arcade , and the Ito Yokado supermarket .
#Text=This is a nice place to shop with the family .
#Text=The mall is a short walk from Koshien Stadium .
#Text=Nishinomiya Gardens ( 西宮ガーデンズ ) .
#Text=This relatively new mall ( as of 2016 ) at Nishinomiya-Kitaguchi Station on the Hankyu line features over 400 specialty shops , restaurants , and a movie theater .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Eden ( 韓国料理エデン ) , ☏ +81 798-43-3876 . 3-17 Ueda-Nishimachi ( ３－１７上田西町 ) .
#Text=A local favorite !
#Text=This is a small restaurant with a very friendly staff ( speaks some English ) and delicious , traditional Korean dishes .
#Text=Vegetarian options available .
#Text=Take Hanshin Bus from Hanshin Koshien Station bound for either Mukogawa-danchi ( 武庫川団地 ) or Naruohama ( 鳴尾浜 ) and get off at Ueda-Nishimachi ( 上田西町 ) .
#Text=Walk about one block north and the restaurant is on a corner on the left .
#Text=Bus fare is ¥ 210 .
#Text=Cafe NADI , New Kobe Building 2F , 7-21 Shoraisho ( 松籟荘7-21 ニューコーベビル2F ) , ☏ +81 798-52-7080 .
#Text=Closed every Tuesday .
#Text=Indonesian and Asian food restaurant owned by a Japanese wife and an Indonesian husband often dressed in Balinese attire .
#Text=Small restaurant but has a nice and cozy atmosphere .
#Text=Nasi Goreng and Mie Goreng are some of the favorites .
#Text=Asian souvenirs available for sale .
#Text=Take the train to Hankyu Kotoen Station and walk about 2 minutes south of the station .
#Text=Gontaro Sushi ( 権太呂すし ) , Nishinomiya-shi Kofuen 1-7-9 ( 〒622-0832 西宮市甲風園 1-7-9 ) ( just north of Nishinomiya-Kitaguchi Station on the Hankyu line ) , ☏ +81 798-63-8333 . 11:00 - 23:00 .
#Text=A small sushi bar just north of Nishinomiya-Kitaguchi Station on the Hankyu line .
#Text=An English menu is available and they are great for the price ! 15 seats .
#Text=Okonomiyaki Tombo ( お好み焼き とんぼ ) , 9-5 Minamikoshikiiwacho ( 南越木岩町9-5 ) , ☏ +81 798-73-0950 . 17:30 - 21:30 , closed Thursdays . . .
#Text=Tonbo is a family-run okonomiyaki and teppanyaki restaurant that is over 20 years old .
#Text=It ’s across from main exit of Kurakuenguchi Station ( 苦楽園口 ) on the Hankyu Koyo Line ( 阪急甲陽線 ) .
#Text=The food is very popular with the sizeable ex-pat community in the neighborhood and Japanese locals alike , especially families .
#Text=Tonbo serves Kansai Okonomiyaki plus regional variations like Hiroshimayaki , modanyaki , and monjayaki .
#Text=Try the popular buta-kimuchi ( grilled pork with Korean kimchee ) .
#Text=The owner is a former Hanshin Tigers pitcher and some local sports stars come in on occasion .
#Text=Some English spoken .
#Text=English menu available .
